intro: Geranium album, commonly known as the white geranium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Geranium album is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
